item.description:
Huge trees tower over the water of this meandering stream. The white oak and pine are of great size, some standing over 100 feet tall.  Orioles are abundant as well as beaver and other species.

The Exeter River is surprisingly wild in this section considering that it runs through a fairly large town (by NH standards!).  Exeter is under an hour from most of the Boston area, & less than half an hour from Newburyport.

This will be an easy, non-tidal river paddle with little current to contend with.  Relax after work on a scenic river.

Rental Kayak available.   Email Larry for details.

  Directions: From the bandstand in downtown Exeter, follow signs for Rt 108 south on Front St. Bear left on Court St/Rt 108. Turn left on Bell St.

Liability Release

AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer and his heirs, and all members and participants of the Seacoast Outdoors Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.
As organizer I make no claims regarding any expertise for this outing. Fee is for meetup site expenses and planning. This is not a guided tour. -Larry Pilla
item.name: Exeter River Excellent Adventure Paddle
